text: Ni Hao FoodTubers, Tim Shieff here- athlete, world champion free-runner, and also a vegan.
I've spent a lot of time in Asia recently and I like taking inspiration from different cultures in

into my vegan lifestyle when trying to create new
recipes and today I've come up with a super
easy Chinese noodle salad rice, we've got rice noodles, we've got mushrooms, spinach,
as well as all your classic Asian flavors like ginger, garlic, chili, lime...the list goes on

this recipe serves about four people, one big bowl,
everyone can tuck in-let's get into it
got about 200 grams worth of rice noodles, you wanna just cover that with water
you do this first so they can be cooking while you're making the rest of the salad
take a selection of mushrooms, we've got oyster and shiitake, and a couple of the fancy looking ones

you wanna slice them down, mushrooms are a good source of vitamin b2
which is great for brain and nervous system

buy any mushrooms you want, whatever you can get at
the supermarket-the crazier looking the better
I'm not going to cut these ones up, you can just tear them apart
these are enoki mushrooms as well
like nature's cheese string
now this bowl's full and there's not mush-room for anything else you're ready, with the mushroom
one long red chilli, slice it down the middle, take the seeds out
two cloves of garlic, slice them up nice and thin
in China they use garlic and chilli so reggo', on everything
slice the chilli nice and finely
next, thumb a ginger
peel it, just scrape it off the edge, once you've done that you wanna cut it into small matchsticks
it might take you a while but it's worth it, once you've sliced the ginger it's time to make matchsticks out of courgette
we'll cut it into three, so that it's a more manageable size

don't worry about it being exactly the same
size as your ginger,
cos' it's a soft vegetable, it's gonna cook quickly anyway
once your courgettes are matchsticked up, we're gonna take six spring onions and slice them up
save the dark green end, later on for garnish, next you wanna grab half a bunch of corriander
I'm gonna slice that up, stalks and all, I'm gonna reserve the leaves for later, along with the tops of the green onions
that's your veg chopped  up
you wanna put your wok on a high heat, add a lug of oil once that's hot
you wanna take the mushrooms we cut up earlier, add them to the pan, let them soften
now the mushrooms are soft, you wanna add all your veg, to the wok, cook that off for a few minutes til your veg is soft and golden
whilst your veg is frying off, we're gonna make the sauce
1 teaspoon of corn flour, to help it thicken, soy sauce 2 tablespoons, low salt like the vegetables we've used
about 1 tablespoon of agave syrup, 1 teaspoon of sesame oil
1/2 a tablespoon or a splash of rice wine
finally a splash of water, mhmm.
veg is fried up, now the sauce is added, just wanna bring it all together
make sure all your veg is coated up, while that's cooking, we're gonna drain your rice noodles
give them a quick rinse under cold water, 100 grams of spinach great source of iron, protein
I like to look to nature for answers with nutrition and you look at gorillas, biggest, strongest animals in the jungle
they eat leafy greens all day, just like that
add it to your rice noodles, add it to the pan
tear in most of the remaining coriander leaves, save a few for the end, turn it over in the pan
smelling great
let's plate this up, I love the way the rice noodles are so white, but you see the red chilli, or the greens throughout

super-healthy, golden brown of the mushroom looking
delightful, my stomach is ready for this
just to finish off, sprinkle the tips of the spring onion and the remainder of the coriander leaves
give it a lovely finish- and there you have it!
Chinese noodle salad, whack it in the middle of the table, everyone can tuck in, you can change it up how you want
add whatever mushrooms or sauces on the end, but I like it just as it is, I'm gonna give it a try
delicious
those mushrooms add such a great texture, contrasting with the a soft rice noodles and all the great Asian flavours you want as well
thanks for watching FoodTubers, don't forget if you want to see more of me- click on my channel LiveWire, right here
and if you want to see me make a fantastic watermelon slushie, for any occasion, click right here
and as always don't forget to comment below, I'll be involved in the comments
LIKE and SUBSCRIBE, until next time!
